newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Five wounded by shotgun blast at Bogota airport.
newsitem.headline: Five wounded by shotgun blast at Bogota airport.

text.p: Five people were injured at Bogota's El Dorado airport on Friday when a security guard accidentally fired off a blast from his shotgun, authorities said.

The shooting occurred at the main domestic entrance to the terminal building as the guard was speaking on a public telephone while cradling his shotgun in one arm, according to Col. Francisco Bermudez, commander of the airport police.
"It seems that it slipped or fell away from him and went off when he grabbed it, wounding five people in their lower extremities," Bermudez told a local radio station.
He added that the victims were all believed to be Colombian nationals and said one of them was seriously injured.
